column1: Khandela is a town and municipality in the Sikar district of the Indian state of Rajasthan.
The name Khandela is believed to have been originated from the sage named Khandel. He had 72 sons from whom 72 clans of Khandelwal originated. Some of those clans are Atolia
Khandela is at 27.36°N 75.30°E﻿ / 27.36; 75.30. It has an average elevation of 318 metres (1043 feet).

column3: 475. Males constitute 51% of the population and females 49%.

column1: Khandela has an average literacy rate of 57%
column2: lower than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 69%
column3: and female literacy is 45%. In Khandela
